dismissalComment.html: Two in Two for Shoriful Islam! Brooks followed his partner playing a loose stroke. Length and wide outside the line, attempts to slice it over the point region, nicked behind off the outside edge. Loud appeal from the keeper and the umpire raised his finger.

headshotImage.longCaption: Rovman Powell player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Good length ball with slight turn stayed low on middle-leg, Powell moves across the line and attempts to negate it to the onside, missed the line completely and thuds the front pad. Huge shout from the fielding team and umpire Wilson raises his finger. Powell decides to review the decision immediately, replay shows no bat involved, impact in line and hitting the leg stump. West Indies lose their review. Good decision by the umpire

dismissalComment.html: Cleaned him up! Good length ball drifting in, Pooran misread the line and attempts to cut it square, too close to the body, misses the length and clean bowled

commentTextItems.html: Short of a length stayed low on the leg stump, moves across the line and swings it away in the gap between fine leg and backward square leg to pick up a boundary and complete the run chase

commentPostTextItems.html: That's all from today's game. Do join us for the 2nd ODI on 13th July. Till then take care and good night. Signing off on behalf of Thilak, Raghav and myself, Rashad.

Tamim Iqbal: The wicket was difficult for both the teams. Winning the toss was the best part of the game. As a team, we didn't get greedy looking at the pitch. [on the runout] It's not a blame-game here. These things happen. [On Nasum] He has been doing well in T20's. Good to see him bowl

Nicholas Pooran: In hindsight they [runs] weren't enough but it was difficult to play on that pitch. Bangladesh played well. The conditions changed from the time we batted. That said, we should've played well in the Powerplay overs. Everyone knows how Gudakesh bowls. So, to play in front of his home crowd was nice

Mehidy Hasan Miraz is the player of the match: We haven't been able to practice much in the the last 10 days because of the rains. We have played really well in ODI cricket. We won the series against South Africa. Everyone in the team knows their roles.

5:35pm local time: Bangladesh win the match by 6 wickets and lead the 3 match series by 1-0. Bangladesh retained their composure and won the game in a low-scoring contest that had few highs and lows for either squad. Even if the outcome would have been different had Pooran not unluckily lost two wickets against Mahmudullah, who hit an undefeated 41 on both occasions. Bangladesh got off to a fast start thanks to Tamim's outstanding opening to the innings, Shanto's useful knock, and later, Mahmudullah and Nurul's vital combination, which propelled them beyond the finish line. Bangladesh still needs to make a lot of improvements, particularly in the batting and fielding areas, despite winning the game.
Despite having a stellar debut, Motie only took one wicket while bowling. The batsmen for West Indies need to up their game and learn from their errors from this encounter.

commentTextItems.html: Good length outside off, taps it to the offside
Short pitched delivery wide outside off, attempts to pull it away but hits the toe end of the bat, mistimes it to square leg
Back of a length ball onto the pads, squeezed to fine leg for a single
Back of a length wide outside off, shuffles across and negates it to short mid wicket
Fuller length onto the pads, clipped away to the sweeper fielder near the boundary ropes on the onside for a couple

dismissalText.commentary: Rovman Powell lbw b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 9 (11b 0x4 0x6 22m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Good length ball with slight turn stayed low on middle-leg, Powell moves across the line and attempts to negate it to the onside, missed the line completely and thuds the front pad. Huge shout from the fielding team and umpire Wilson raises his finger. Powell decides to review the decision immediately, replay shows no bat involved, impact in line and hitting the leg stump. West Indies lose their review. Good decision by the umpire

dismissalText.commentary: Gudakesh Motie c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Shoriful Islam 7 (11b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 63.63

dismissalComment.html: Two in the over again for Shoriful today! Short and wide outside off, Motie stretched his arms and manages to guide it aerially straight to Mehidy at the backward point position.

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Phillip) 33 (25b 4x4 1x6 37m) SR: 132

dismissalComment.html: Chance of a run out and GONE! Short of a length ball outside off, Shanto dabs it to the gully fielder and calls for a single, Tamim responds and sets off. Phillip collects the ball and has a go at the stumps at the striker's end, hits the timber. Tamim is well short of his ground. Good piece of fielding by Phillip

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das lbw b Hosein 1 (9b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 11.11

dismissalComment.html: Good length ball drifting in, Litton attempts to defend off the front foot, misses the line and hits the front pad. Loud appeal from the Windies' team, Umpire Wilson takes his time and raises his finger. Litton reviews it immediately, replay shows no bat involved, pitching in line, impact in line and clipping the edge of the leg stump which is the umpire's call. Litton looks disappointed as he walks off the field towards the dressing room.
